newsitem.title: USA: Tax panel endorses Kansas City entertainment plan.
newsitem.headline: Tax panel endorses Kansas City entertainment plan.

text.p: Plans to develop a $444 million entertainment district in downtown Kansas City were moving forward Thursday after the city's tax increment financing commission unanimously endorsed the project.

The commission Wednesday approved Centertainment Inc's Power & Light District proposal, which would put movie theaters, shops, restaurants and a parking garage on the south portion of downtown Kansas City.
Centertainment, a development unit of Kansas City-based AMC Entertainment Inc, wants to use $172 million in tax increment financing to help pay for the project.
Final approval of the plan rests with the Kansas City Council, which could take up the matter in the next four to six weeks.
